One of the best Counter Strike games. Actually, it looks like a mix of original Counter Strike with Counter Strike: Global Offensive.

Counter-Strike: Source - But it's 2021!?

Before PC gaming and realistic shooters like this one came into my life, I was a COD player over on the PS3 (@Sargenttoastie28 I probably you thrashed you ;) ) and I never saw myself playing a shooter like Counter-Strike due to it's easy to learn, hard to master mechanics. Sure anyone can shoot, but can you control the recoil? Well I regret being a pussy and cowering fear over the fact there is no health regeneration system because those easy to learn, realistic mechanics that are hard to master is what makes the game so fun and addictive! 

Counter-Strike: Source lacks any form of story to be told. The most you'll come across that you can consider characters in this game is T's CT's and hostages. Whilst this may turn away some who like to have a story in their game such as myself it's actually a great game to just throw away some time into without having to think about all these different plot elements.

Counter-Strike: Source is a remake of Counter-Strike (a mod for Half-Life) in the source engine with better graphics, physics and much more! You play as two teams, Terrorist (or T's) and Counter-Terrorists (CT's) on a variety of maps in two different game modes. Firstly, there is your regular plant-the-bomb gamemode which essentially places the T's with the job of planting the bomb on a certain part of the map whilst the CT's defend this part and diffuse the bomb if planted. Despite its simplicity it is very intense and addictive to play especially in the later parts of each round where the numbers are smaller and the steaks are higher. The second gamemode available is the Hostage situation gamemode in which the T's are tasked with guarding Hostages that the CT's have to rescue and take back to their spawn, I got hooked on this one but it can get very boring and repetitive after sometime. Guns in the game feel amazing to control and powerful. Skill is taken to master some but once done it is a very, very satisfying feeling to pop constant headshots with an AK. Movement also feels very fluent. 

Being ran on the Source engine means that the game looks even better before and I cannot deny this. Guns have a huge level of detail and so do maps and much more! Not to mention the physics in this game would've been outstanding at the time and are quite impressive still.

The game also sounds amazing. Guns, footsteps and all the rest is clear and they sound amazing.

But there has to be some cons right? I've given it this much praise it's about time I dump on it right? Well as the review title states, it's 2021. Don't go into this game expecting a massively multiplayer scene alive and filled with players. Nowdays it's populated by the French, Russians and bots so sometimes you'll need to mute, sometimes there will be ez bots, sometimes there will be no one at all! But if you find a good server be sure to add it to your favourites and you can hop on it when you please!

To conclude, in 2021 when the game is 17 years old it still holds up very well and is a great takeaway from reality that allows you to focus your mind on fast pace shooting and kicking noob/bot/Russian & French butt! 

8/10 - Neppy review
